meanings.definition: An amino acid that is a precursor to arginine and is found in watermelon.
meanings.sent2: The body uses citrulline to make arginine.
meanings.sent3: The watermelon blushed when it realized it was full of citrulline.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness flowed through her veins like citrulline.
meanings.sent5: The citrulline in watermelon gives it a refreshing taste.

meanings.definition: A compound that plays a key role in the urea cycle in the liver.
meanings.sent1: The liver processes citrulline in the urea cycle.
meanings.sent2: Citrulline helps remove ammonia from the body.
meanings.sent3: The liver thanked citrulline for its help in cleaning up.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work was as essential as citrulline in the liver.
meanings.sent5: The citrulline in the liver worked tirelessly to detoxify the body.

meanings.definition: A non-protein amino acid that is involved in the production of nitric oxide in the body.
meanings.sent1: Nitric oxide production relies on citrulline.
meanings.sent2: Citrulline helps boost nitric oxide levels.
meanings.sent3: The bodybuilders cheered for citrulline, their nitric oxide booster.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the effect of citrulline on nitric oxide.
meanings.sent5: The citrulline-powered nitric oxide surged through his veins during the workout.
